shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily office prayers II) Śәrʿatä qәddase "Ordinary of the Mass" III) Anaphoras
Additiones 1-4.

owners.owner: According to Additiones 2-4, the donor is ʾabba Wärädä Qal (fols. 98ra, 114vb, 131vb, 132ra, 132rb); his son Täwäldä Mädḫǝn is also mentioned (fols. 84vb, 102va, 107rb).

dcomments.dcomment: 1706-08 or 1769-77 A.D. Additio 4 is followed by a hardly readable addition (fol. 132vb) which contains a hint to dating: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ […] በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ፪ቲ፡ … “This book […] at the time of our King Täklä Haymanot, the second … (?)”. Probably King Täklä Haymanot I (1706-08) or II (r. 1769-1777) is meant.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is very worn, many leaves are dirty. The spine cover and the endbands are torn off.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Quires A, I are reinforced by parchment guards made of re-utilized leaves of a different (older?) manuscript.

squires.squire: A(2/ fols. I-II ) — I(5/fols. 1r-10v) — II(8/s.l.: 3, stub after 6/fols. 11r-18v) — III(10/fols. 19r- 28v) — IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) — V(8/fols. 37r-44v) — VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) — VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) — VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) — IX(9/s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 70r-77v) — X(8/fols. 78r-85v) — XI(8/fols. 86r-93v) — XII(8/fols. 94r-101v) — XIII(8/fols. 102r) — XIV(8/fols. 110r-117v) — XV(8/fols. 118r-125v) — XVI(4/fols. 126r-129v) — XVII(3/fols. 130r-132v/s.l. cut).

taunit.rl-info: The pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 7v). Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Careful and regular, by well-trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; titles and incipits of the prayers, litanies, anaphoras; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs. The words: ካዕበ፡ (ወካዕበ፡) and በዝየ፡

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይሕ ፡ (sometimes ይ፡ሕ፡) for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይካ፡ (sometimes ይ፡ካ፡) for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ (sometimes ይ፡ዲ፡) for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ በእ፡ for በእንተ፡ ቡ፡ or ቡራ for ቡራኬ፡ ይብ፡ for ይብል፡

desccontent.mss: CRAbb 70 (17th cent.), fol. 18v : “prières de l’encens pour le matin (ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ ዘነግህ፡)” (CRAbb 110, no. 72). EMML no. 475 (1881/89), fols. 96r-97v: “Schematic rite of Incense [Ṣalota ‘eṭān]” (EMML II, 203). EMML no. 1434 (1680), fols. 3r-10r: “Prayer of Incense [Ṣalota ‘eṭān]”: fol. 3v: “[Ṣalota ‘eṭān]”.
desccontent.incipit: Fol. 1r: ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ ዘነግህ፡ ዘግብጽ፡ ወቁም፡ ዲያቆን፡ ቅድመ፡ ቅድመ[sic]፡ መካን፡ ወይሚጥ፡ ገጾ፡ መንገለ፡ ምዕራበ፨ ወይብል፡ ተንሥኡ፡ ለጸሎት፨ ይብሉ፡ ሕዝብ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሃለነ፤ ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ሰላም፡ ለኵልክሙ፤…
desccontent.itranslation: [Fol. 1r]: Morning Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt. And the deacon shall stand in front of the beginning of the place and he shall turn his face towards East and say: "Stand up for the prayer". The people say: "O Lord have mercy upon us"; the priest says: "Peace unto you all…"
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 25va, l.23: …ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ለከ፡ ምስለከ፡ወምስለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መንፈስ፤ ስብሐት፡ ወ[fol. 25vb]መለኮት፡ ወክብር፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፤ ይ፡ሕ፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨
desccontent.etranslation: [Fol. 25va]: …And our Saviour Jesus Christ, in whom for you and with you, and with the Holy Spirit glory and divinity and honour, now and for ever. World without end. The people say: Amen.
desccontent.details:
I-1) Fols. 1ra –5vb (l.6): Ṣälotä ˁǝṭan zä-nägǝh zä-Gǝbṣ “Morning Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt”.
I-2) Fols. 5vb (l.7) –8rb (l.7): Ṣälotä ˁǝṭan zä-śärk zä-Gǝbṣ “Evening Prayer of the Incense, from Egypt” (Ms. d’Abbadie 72, fol. 30r, CRAbb 110, no. 70, I. “prières de l’encens pour le soir, selon les Coptes (ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ ዘሰርክ፡ ዘግብጽ፡)”).
I-3) Fols. 8rb (l.17) – 8va (l.1): Särawitä mälaˀǝktihu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm yǝqäwwǝmu qǝdmehu lä-mädḫane ˁaläm wä-yǝkellǝlǝwwo… Fragment of “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred” (cp. MQ, “Qəddase śälästu məˀət”, §132; DMEthLit “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred, §132”) repeated 16 times, with different musical notation and different headings: Zä-sänuy “Of Monday”; Zä- räbuˁ  “Of Wednesday”; Zä-ˁarb “Of Friday”; Zä-qädam “Of Saturday”; Zä-ˀəhud “Of Sunday”; Zäwätǝr “Of every day”; Zä-9 bäˁalät “Of nine feasts”; Zä-ˀǝgzǝˀtǝnä Maryam “Of Our Lady Maryam”; Zä-näbiyat  “Of the prophets”; Zä-ḥawaryat “Of the Apostles”; ˁƎzl “(Mode of chant)”; Zä-ṣadqan “Of the righteous”; Zä-sämaˁ ǝtat “Of the martyrs”; Zä-mälaˀǝkt “Of the angels”; Araray “(Mode of chant)”; Zä-kirubel  “Of Cherubs”.
I-4) Fols. 9vb (l. 12) – 10rb (l.7): Ṣälotä haymanot  “Prayer of the Faith”, Confession of the Faith of 318 Fathers (MQ, “Qəddase śälästu məˀət”, §§1-10; DMEthLit, “The Anaphora of the Three Hundred, §§1-10”).
I-5) Fols. 10rb (l.8) – 14rb (l.3): Mäṣḥafä kidan “Book of the Testament”:
Kidan zä-nägh Introduction and “Testament of the Morning”; Kidan zä-śärk “Testament of the Evening”.
I-6) Fol. 14rb (l.3) – 14va (l.5): Liṭon zä-śärk “Litany of the Evening” (MSKLiton 15).
I-7) Fols. 14va (l.1) – 17rb (l.3): Supplications:
Mästäbqwǝˁ zä-lelit “Supplication of the Night” (MSKLiton 17-18, Mästäbqwǝˁan zäyǝbäqqwǝˁu lä-ṣälot bäˀǝntä kwǝllu gǝbr); Ṣäwatǝw zäˀabäwinä ḥawaryat “Series (of Supplications) of our Fathers the Apostles” (MSKLiton 18-26, from Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä duyan to Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä sälam).
I-8) Fols. 17rb (l.4) – 20ra (l.9): Litanies:

Liṭon zä-sänuy “Litany of Monday”; Zä-śällus “Of Tuesday”; Zä-räbuˁ “(Litany) of Wednesday”; Zä-ḥamus “(Litany) of Thursday”; Zä-qädam“(Litany) of Saturday”; Zäˀǝhud “(Litany) of Sunday”; Zä-mäḫatǝwä Fasika “Of Easter Eve” (MSKLiton 8-17, from Liṭon zä-sänuy to Liṭon zä-qädam śǝˁur).

I-9) Fols.20ra (l.10)– 22va (l.2): Supplications:
Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ. Bäl. ˀƎgziˀa ḥəywätä mutan täsfa qəbuṩan rädaˀe mənduban … (MSKLiton 38-40, the second part of Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu);
Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu aḫawinä kämä näfsomu yagˁǝz wǝstä mäkan śǝˁur ḫabä mayä ˁǝräft … (MSKLiton 36-38, the first part of Mästäbqwǝˁ bä-ˀǝntä ˀǝllä nomu);

ˀƎgziˀabǝḥer ˀǝgziˀabǝḥer ˀIyäsus Krǝstos ˀamlakǝnä zä-tǝbelo lä-fǝqurǝkä Yoḥannǝs… (MSKLiton 40-41, Mästäbäqwǝˁ zä-ǝgzǝˀtǝnä Maryam); Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ lä-ǝgzǝˀtǝnä kwǝllǝnä Maryam ǝmmǝnä wä-ǝmu lä-ǝgziˀǝnä…; Wäkaˁǝbä nastäbǝqqwǝˁ lä-ˁǝṩä qǝddus mäsqäl ṣǝnuˁa śǝltan wä-ḫayl…

I-10) Fols. 22va (l.3) – 25vb (l.5): Mästäbqwǝˁ zä-lelit “Supplication of the Night”: Nastäbǝqqwǝˁ zä-kwǝllo yǝˀǝḫḫǝz ǝgziˀabǝḥer ab lä-ˀǝgzi wä mädḫaninä Iyäsus Krǝstos. ˀƎsmä räsäyännä tädlä…
I-11) Fols. 22vb (l.5) – 25vb (l.3): Zä-Yared zä-yǝnäggǝś “Zä-yǝnäggǝś of Yared” (MSKLiton 26-36).

desccontent.text: II. Śәrʿatä qәddase "Ordinary of the Mass"

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 26ra, l.1: እመቦ፡ ጳጳስ፡ አው፡ ኤጲስቆጶስ፡ አው፡ ቀሲስ፡ አው፡ ዲያቆኖን። ዘኢተምህረ፡ ወኢያእመረ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ኪዳን፡ እስከ፡ ፍጻሜ፨ ሲኖዶስ፡ ወዲድስቅልያ፡ ወሥርዓተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨
desccontent.itranslation: [Fol. 26ra]: If there is a patriarch, or a bishop, or a priest, or a deacon who did not leard and does not know the Book of the Testament until the end, the Senodos, the Didascalia, and the Ordinary of the Mass…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 48rb, l.4: በኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ዘ፫ቱ፡ ለከ፡ ምስሌሁ፡ ወምስለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መንፈስ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወእኂዝ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም ።
desccontent.details:
II-1) Fols. 26ra (l.1) – 26ra (l.19): “The Canon”: ˀƎmmäbo ṗaṗas ˀaw ˀeṗisqoṗos ˀaw qäsis…  (MQ II, §62; DMEthLit II, §62).
II-2) Fols. 26ra (20th line) – 26va (18th line): Śǝrˁatä qǝddase zä-qǝddus Basǝlyos“The order of liturgy of St. Basil” (cp. MQ II, §§ 11-16; DMEthLit II, §11-16).
II-3) Fols.26va (18th line) – 27ra (6th line): Ṣälot zä-qǝddus Gorgoryos “Prayer of St. Gregory”.
II-4) Fols. 27ra (7th line) – 27va (1st line): Ṣälot gǝbˀatä mänṭolaˁt zä-qǝddus Basǝlyos” / “Prayer of St. Basil: the Entering of the Curtain”.
II-5) Fols. 27va (1st line) – 30va (18th line): Ten prayers over the vessels of the Church.
II-6) Fols. 30va (l.19) – 31rb (l.7): Directives for the ministers, “The order of liturgy”: Śǝrˁatä qǝddase zä-yǝqeddes kahǝn yǝqum bä-fǝrhat. Mäqdämä kwǝllu yǝsgǝd qǝdmä tabot mǝˁǝrä… (the part until …yǝbarǝk wäyǝlbäs, fol. 31ra, is in MQ II, §§63-64; the rest from Mimäṭän gǝrǝmt… is in MQ III, §§1-3).
II-7) Fols. 31rb (l.7) – 32ra (l.1): Ṣälot laˁlä mäsob “Prayer over the Basket”.
II-8) Fols. 32ra (l.1) – 34rb (l.1): Ṣälot laˁlä mäbaˀ “Prayer over the offering (to God)”.
II-9) Fols. 34rb (l.1) – 34va (l.13): Ṣälotä ˀǝnfora “Prayer of Anaphora”.
II-10) Fols. 34va (13th line) – 34vb (23th line): Təˀəzazä ˀabäwinä ḥawaryat “The command of our fathers the Apostles”.
II-11) Fols. 35ra (l. 1) – 36ra (l.12): Fətḥat zä-wäld “Absolution of the Son” (MQ III, §§56-65).
II-12) Fol. 36ra (l.12) – 36rb (l.7): Prayer (???).
II-13) Fols. 36 (l.7) – 37vb (l.7): Supplications (MQ III, §§66-98).
II-14) Fols. 37vb (l. 8) – 47rb (l.9): Prayers of the solemn censing (cp. MQ III, §100 – IV; §§ 30).
II-15) Fols. 47rb (l. 10) – 47vb (l.13): Ceremonial washing of the hands (the Lavabo) (cp. MQ IV, §§46-48).
II-16) Fols. 47vb (l.14) – 48rb (l.4) Ṣälotä ˀamməḫa zä-Basəlyos  “Prayer of the Kiss (of Peace) of Basil” (MQ IV, §§52-61).

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 48rb, l.9 (Anaphora of the Apostles): ይካ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስለ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ይሕ፡ ምስለ፡ መንፈስከ፡ ይካ፡ አእኵትዎ፡ ለአምላክነ፡…፨ አኰቴተ፡ ቍርባን፡ ዘቅዱሳን፡ ወኅሩያን፡ አባዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት፡…ነአኲተከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በፍቁር፡ ወልድከ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘበደኃሪ፡ መዋዕል፡…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 129vb: ... …ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። ዘቦቱ፡ ለከ[n.l.]፡ እለ፡ ትቀውሙ፤ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘለዓለም፡ በል።

additional.cont: Fols. 130ra, l.1 - 131vb, l.17: Calendaric calculations and a register of church feasts.

additional.add: Fol. 131vb, l.18: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአሲር፡ መትራ፡ ዘአባ፡ ወረደ፡ ቃል፡ ቃቃ [?]

additional.cont: Fol. 132ra, ls. 1-24: Ownership note.
additional.add: Fol. 132ra, l.1: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘኣባ፡ ወረደ፡ ቃል፡ …

additional.cont: Fol. 132vb, ls. 1-26: Ownership note extended with the record concerning the land issues.
additional.add: Fol. 132vb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወረደ፡ ቃል፡ ወለውሉዱ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኃን፡<...>፡ እምየ፡ ኃደረ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለውሉዱ፡ ወለተ፡ ትንሣኤ፡ ወለተ፡ ስላሤ። ፲፪ገራህቲ፡ ፈረቃ፡ ዓዲ፡ ጨኦኒት፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ወረደ፡ቃል፡ ለአሲር፡ ምትራ፡ መስቀል፡ መጋረዠ፡ ፬መጽሓፍ፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ወረደ፡ ቃል፡ እመሂ፡ ገራህት፡ ወእመሂ፡ ኦና፡ ወእመሂ፡ መስቀል፡ ወእመሂ፡ መጋረዠ፡ ወእመሂ፡ መጻሕፍቲሃ፡ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ፪ቲ፡ ጉና፡ ጉና፡ ፩ስሐሌታ፡[n.l.]...
additional.det: The note is a version of the previous one, somewhat longer and with some differences. The final part is unintelligible.

extras.extra: - Crude note on fol. II: መምሕር፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ መምሕር፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ መምሕር፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ወልደ፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን - Crude note in the upper margin of fol. 70r: ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም - Other crude notes in the upper margin of the fols., referring to the liturgical useof the Ms.
